ca.ualberta.cs.swapmyride

Class DataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cs.swapmyride.DataManager

  • public class DataManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Data manager is designed to ensure that all serializing, loading, and saving of data in the app.
    Author:
    Garry Bullock on 2015-11-02

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataManager(Context context) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteUser(java.lang.String username)
      deleteUser deletes the serialized data for a user that is located in the database.
      User loadUser(java.lang.String userName)
      Load user reads a user from internal disk, using the user name given as a unique file name.
      void saveUser(User user)
      Save user converts the given user object into a Json string, and then attempts to write it to internal disk space.
      boolean searchUser(java.lang.String username)
      Takes in a username and searches through the database to see if the user exists.
      void updateFriends(User user)
      updateFriends gets friends from the server based on the friends list of a user.

      • loadUser

        public User loadUser(java.lang.String userName)
        Load user reads a user from internal disk, using the user name given as a unique file name.
        Parameters:

      • saveUser

        public void saveUser(User user)
        Save user converts the given user object into a Json string, and then attempts to write it to internal disk space. The user can the be found under the unique filename that is the same as their username. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19459082/read-and-write-data-with-gson
        Parameters:
        user - user to write to internal disk
        user -
        See Also:
        stackOverflow

      • searchUser

        public boolean searchUser(java.lang.String username)
        Takes in a username and searches through the database to see if the user exists. If the user exists, it returns true. Else, returns false.
        Parameters:
        username -
        Returns:
        True or False

      • updateFriends

        public void updateFriends(User user)
        updateFriends gets friends from the server based on the friends list of a user. This exists so that a friendsList does not store user obejcts - but just usernames so that it is smaller.
        Parameters:
        user -
